title: 115_hr2799
content: The Act is titled the "Western Water Recycling and Drought Relief Act." It amends the Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act to include the Benicia Water Reuse Project. The Act authorizes the Benicia Water Reuse Project, allowing the Secretary to participate in the design and construction of recycled water system facilities in cooperation with the City of Benicia, California. The Federal share of the project cost is limited to 25%, with no funds provided for operation and maintenance. $6,750,000 is authorized for appropriations. The Secretary is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities in cooperation with the City of Brentwood, California. The Federal share of the project cost is limited to 25%, with no funds provided for operation and maintenance. $5,200,000 is authorized for appropriations. The Secretary is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities in cooperation with the Dublin San Ramon Services District, California. The Federal share of the project cost is limited to 25%, with no funds provided for operation and maintenance. $1,150,000 is authorized for appropriations. The Secretary is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities in cooperation with the City of Redwood City, California. The Federal share of the project cost is limited to 25%, with no funds provided for operation and maintenance. $7,500,000 is authorized for appropriations. "Authorization for the City of Pleasanton Recycled Water Project with a 25% Federal cost share, no funds for operation and maintenance, and an authorization of $5,000,000. Authorization for the Concord Recycled Water Project is also included." The Secretary is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities in cooperation with the Central Contra Costa Sanitary District, with a Federal cost share not exceeding 25% of the total project cost. Funds for operation and maintenance will not be provided, and $1,000,000 is authorized for this project. The Secretary is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities in cooperation with the Central Contra Costa Sanitary District. The Federal share of the project cost should not exceed 25%, and funds for operation and maintenance will not be provided. $6,250,000 is authorized for this project. The Secretary is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities in cooperation with Delta Diablo, California. The Federal share of the project cost should not exceed 25%, and funds for operation and maintenance will not be provided. $8,500,000 is authorized for this project. The Secretary is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities in cooperation with Delta Diablo, California. The Federal share of the project cost should not exceed 25%, and funds for operation and maintenance will not be provided. $12,500,000 is authorized for this project. The Secretary is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities in cooperation with the Dublin San Ramon Services District and DERWA in California. The Federal share of the project cost should not exceed 25%, and funds for operation and maintenance will not be provided. $6,300,000 is authorized for this project. The Secretary is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities in cooperation with the City of Hayward, California. The Federal share of the project cost should not exceed 25%, and funds for operation and maintenance will not be provided. $3,000,000 is authorized for this project. The Secretary is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water distribution systems with the Ironhouse Sanitary District in California. The Federal share of the project cost should not exceed 25%, and funds for operation and maintenance will not be provided. $5,000,000 is authorized for this project. The Secretary, in cooperation with the Ironhouse Sanitary District, California, is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water distribution systems. The Federal share of the project cost should not exceed 25%, and funds for operation and maintenance will not be provided. $3,500,000 is authorized for this project. Ironhouse Sanitary District and the Secretary are authorized to work on a recycled water distribution project with a Federal cost share limit of 25%. No funds will be provided for project operation and maintenance. $10,000,000 is authorized for this project. The Secretary, in cooperation with the City of Mountain View, California, is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities with a Federal cost share limit of 25%. No funds will be provided for project operation and maintenance. $5,000,000 is authorized for this project. The Secretary, in cooperation with the City of Turlock, California, is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities with a Federal cost share limit of 25%. No funds will be provided for project operation and maintenance. $5,000,000 is authorized for this project. The Secretary, in cooperation with the City of Palo Alto, California, is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities with a Federal cost share limit of 25%. No funds will be provided for project operation and maintenance. $8,250,000 is authorized for this project. "Authorization for the Pure Water Monterey groundwater replenishment project with a Federal cost share limit of 25% and an appropriation of $7,500,000. Authorization is also granted for the San Jose Water Company recycled water project." The Secretary is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities with the San Jose Water Company in California. The Federal share of the project cost should not exceed 25%, and there is an authorization of $6,000,000 for this project. Additionally, the Secretary shall not provide funds for the operation and maintenance of the project. The Secretary, in cooperation with the City of Sunnyvale, California, is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities. The Federal share of the project cost shall not exceed 25%, with an authorization of $500,000 for this project. No funds will be provided for the operation and maintenance of the project. The Secretary, in cooperation with Hawaii Water Service Company, Waikoloa, Hawaii, is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities. The Federal share of the project cost shall not exceed 25%, with an authorization of $3,000,000 for this project. No funds will be provided for the operation and maintenance of the project. The Secretary, in cooperation with the West Bay Sanitary District, California, is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities. The Federal share of the project cost shall not exceed 25%, with an authorization of $5,000,000. No funds will be provided for the operation and maintenance of the project. The Secretary, in cooperation with the Santa Clara Valley Water District and the City of Sunnyvale, California, is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities. The Federal share of the project cost shall not exceed 25%, with an authorization of $4,375,000. No funds will be provided for the operation and maintenance of the project. The Secretary will enter agreements with the Western Recycled Water Coalition agencies to fund projects, including reimbursement for design, planning, and construction costs. The table of contents of the Reclamation Projects Authorization and Adjustment Act of 1992 will be amended. The Secretary will fund various recycled water projects in different cities and districts, including Benicia, Brentwood, Dublin, Redwood City, Pleasanton, Concord, Contra Costa County, Delta Diablo, Hayward, Ironhouse Sanitary District, and San Ramon. The Secretary will fund multiple recycled water projects in various cities and districts, including Ironhouse Sanitary District, Mountain View, North Valley Regional, Palo Alto, Pure Water Monterey, San Jose Water Company, Sunnyvale, Waikoloa Beach Resort, West Bay Sanitary District, and Wolfe Road. Modification to authorized projects includes increasing funding for the Antioch Recycled Water Project to $3,200,000 and for the South Santa Clara County Recycled Water Project to $17,950,000.
